paragraphs.content: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
paragraphs.contentHtml: <small>The Book of the Prophet</small> Isaiah

paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

paragraphs.content: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the LORD hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the Lord hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.

paragraphs.content: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.

paragraphs.content: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the LORD, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the Lord, they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone away backward.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.

paragraphs.content: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and putrifying sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with ointment.

paragraphs.content: Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Your country is desolate, your cities are burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.

paragraphs.content: And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.

paragraphs.content: Except the LORD of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Except the Lord of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and we should have been like unto Gomorrah.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Hear the word of the LORD, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Hear the word of the Lord, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.

paragraphs.content: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the LORD: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me? saith the Lord: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.

paragraphs.content: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts?
paragraphs.contentHtml: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to tread my courts?

paragraphs.content: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with; it is iniquity, even the solemn meeting.

paragraphs.content: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a trouble unto me; I am weary to bear them.

paragraphs.content: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;

paragraphs.content: Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.

paragraphs.content: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the LORD: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

paragraphs.content: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:

paragraphs.content: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.

paragraphs.content: ¶ How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.

paragraphs.content: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:

paragraphs.content: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.

paragraphs.content: Therefore saith the Lord, the LORD of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:

paragraphs.content: ¶ And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away thy dross, and take away all thy tin:

paragraphs.content: And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of righteousness, the faithful city.

paragraphs.content: Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with righteousness.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the LORD shall be consumed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together, and they that forsake the Lord shall be consumed.

paragraphs.content: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.

paragraphs.content: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.

paragraphs.content: And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark, and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
